responses: 0: Clientelistic. Constituents are rewarded with goods, cash, and/or jobs.
2: Local collective. Constituents are rewarded with local collective goods, e.g., wells, toilets, markets, roads, bridges, and local development.
4: Policy/programmatic. Constituents respond to a partyâ€™s positions on national policies, general party programs, and visions for society.
citation: Pemstein et al. (2018, V-Dem Working Paper Series 2018:21); V-Dem Codebook (see suggested citation at the top of this document).
question: Among the major parties, what is the main or most common form of linkage to their constituents?
